cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 275 miles SW of Port–au–Prince, Haiti
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north over Haiti/eastern Cuba, then through the Bahamas and forecast to turn northwest, coming very close to the east-central Florida coast late Thursday into Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: No definite U.S. landfall in the advisory; closest approach expected just offshore the Florida east coast near Cape Canaveral

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Bahamas and Florida east coast from the Keys to Cape Canaveral, then northward toward Georgia–Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm winds are possible late Thu; low but increasing chance (≈10%) of 50-kt winds and small chance of hurricane-force gusts if the core tracks close to shore.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Dangerous surge of 3–5+ ft possible along the Space Coast if Matthew parallels the coast at hurricane strength.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands could produce 4–8 inches of rain with locally higher amounts, leading to flash flooding around Port Canaveral.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large surf, rip currents, and coastal erosion will hamper vessel operations and cargo handling well before closest approach.
